title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1647-5.1 - Segregation of reserves
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1647-5.1 - Segregation of reserves

State Regulations

The segregation of moneys set aside for vacancy and
collection loss, painting and decorating, and replacement reserves, or other
authorized reserves, from other funds, and the deposit thereof in a separate
reserve fund bank account is prescribed. While the moneys set aside for the
individual reserves are pooled in a common reserve fund, separate
accountability of the moneys set aside for each reserve shall be maintained by
means of a general ledger analysis of accounts 1113, Reserve Fund, as described
in section
1642-3.2. Similar provisions apply
with respect to investments of reserve funds. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
1647-5.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
